page.title: 15LODSWORTH FETE
page.content: In a month of miserable weather the biennial fete in aid of{ St.Peter's {Church}was held on{ Saturday,15th June {1985} on a glorious sunny day and attracted a good crowd of some{ 400 people and raised{Â£2176}for St.Peter's It was opened at 2.15pm by the {Rector, the Reverend Norman May,}and the band of Seaford College, under their conductor Mr. Derek Bester, struck up, and played at intervals throughout the afernoon.While the band relaxed, music was continued by three pipers of the Pinstripe Highlanders from London. Teas were served on the lawn and we were entertained by a troupe from the Denise School of Dancing, Haslemere. In the middle of the field there were side_shows and games, including pillow fights on a slippery pole provided by the scouts.
